Key Arguments: The government has previously spread misinformation during the COVID-19 pandemic and has not been held accountable.
The proposed legislation is seen as an attack on free speech and an attempt to control the narrative.
There is a lack of trust in politicians and public servants to manage misinformation and disinformation effectively.
The legislation is viewed as a step towards a totalitarian society by controlling communications and dissent.
The government should focus on improving governance and public trust rather than controlling information.
Notable Quotes: Do these politicians understand that George Orwell wrote the book 1984 as a warning, not a 'how to' instruction manual?
The Australian people have learnt to NOT trust the intentions, the capacity to 'do the right thing', of the political class, and Senior public servants, in this country.
Requiring service providers to retain, and provide, the details of dissidents, dissenters, is a further dangerous step towards a totalitarian society.
